thread.title: House GOP strips immigration language from defense bill
thread.title_full: House GOP strips immigration language from defense bill

title: House GOP strips immigration language from defense bill
text:
House GOP strips immigration language from defense bill Published May 14, 2015 Facebook 0 Twitter 0 Email Print 
WASHINGTON â€“ The House has voted to strip an immigration provision opposed by conservatives from its annual defense policy bill. 
The 221-202 vote targeted a nonbinding provision that would have encouraged a Pentagon study on allowing immigrants brought illegally to the country as kids to enlist in the military. 
Conservatives who pushed the vote say the measure would have encouraged amnesty and validated unconstitutional actions taken by President Barack Obama to protect millions of immigrants from deportation. Supporters say it's a narrow provision aimed only at taking a first step toward opening the military to some immigrants. 
The move by conservatives has angered some fellow Republicans who say it sends the wrong message heading into a presidential election year. Advertisement
